intro: Lasianthus poilanei, commonly known as the Malagasy starflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
